intro: Solanum solum, commonly known as the ghost pepper plant, is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae). It is native to tropical regions of South America and is characterized by its small, vibrant red berries that contain a high concentration of capsaicin. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are ovate with a hairy texture, and its flowers are white or pale yellow, often clustered in small groups. The fruit is not only spicy but also used in various culinary and medicinal applications due to its unique chemical composition.
